questions.title: My first question
questions.description: How to ensure automated and consistent disaster recovery operations through Infrastructure as Code using AWS Services

choices.title: Using AWS CloudFormation or AWS CDK to define disaster recovery infrastructure

helpfulResource.displayText: Use CloudFormation templates or AWS CDK to define disaster recovery infrastructure.

improvementPlan.displayText: Develop and deploy disaster recovery infrastructure using AWS CloudFormation to maintain consistent environments across all regions.

choices.title: Version control for disaster recovery infrastructure code

helpfulResource.displayText: Integrate disaster recovery infrastructure code with AWS CodeCommit or another version control system to enable rollback and track changes over time.

improvementPlan.displayText: Set up an AWS CodePipeline for continuous delivery and automated deployments of disaster recovery infrastructure to maintain consistent and repeatable processes.

questions.title: My second question
questions.description: What monitoring mechanisms have been put in place to ensure operational visibility into disaster recovery process

choices.title: Enabling Amazon CloudWatch Logs and Metrics

helpfulResource.displayText: Use CloudWatch to log and monitor disaster recovery activities.

improvementPlan.displayText: Set up detailed monitoring with CloudWatch to collect logs and metrics on the health and performance of disaster recovery services, enabling quicker detection of issues.

choices.title: Setting up Amazon EventBridge to automate responses to specific operational events

helpfulResource.displayText: Use EventBridge to trigger automated actions in response to specific disaster recovery events..

improvementPlan.displayText: Define EventBridge rules to automatically trigger actions (such as sending alerts or invoking AWS Lambda functions) in response to disaster recovery events, reducing manual intervention.

questions.title: My third question
questions.description: How to maintain operational readiness through regular disaster recovery testing

choices.title: Performing post-test analysis to identify improvements

helpfulResource.displayText: Review test results to identify gaps.

improvementPlan.displayText: After every disaster recovery test, conduct a post-mortem to review the results, identify any areas of weakness, and implement improvements in the recovery plan.

helpfulResource.displayText: Schedule regular drills to validate recovery procedures.

improvementPlan.displayText: Create a disaster recovery testing schedule, conducting at least quarterly drills to verify that the recovery plans work as intended under different failure scenarios.

questions.title: My fourth question
questions.description: Which mechanisms can be used to track and manage operational changes for disaster recovery resources

helpfulResource.displayText: Use AWS Config to track configuration changes.

improvementPlan.displayText: Set up AWS Config to record changes to all disaster recovery resources, ensuring that any modifications are tracked and can be reviewed in case of an issue.

choices.title: Enforcing tagging policies to organize disaster recovery resources

helpfulResource.displayText: Use consistent tagging across all disaster recovery resources.

improvementPlan.displayText: Implement an enforced tagging policy using AWS Config rules and Systems Manager to ensure that all disaster recovery resources are tagged appropriately, enabling easier management and cost tracking.

questions.title: My fifth question
questions.description: How to continuosly improve disaster recovery processes and operations using AWS Services

choices.title: Documenting lessons learned and applying them to operational changes

helpfulResource.displayText: Document and implement improvements based on operational feedback.

improvementPlan.displayText: Maintain an ongoing improvement process where lessons learned from tests, incidents, or system changes are documented and incorporated into operational workflows for disaster recovery

choices.title: Incorporating feedback loops to adjust recovery processes based on failures or changes

helpfulResource.displayText: Regularly update disaster recovery processes based on performance.

improvementPlan.displayText: Create a feedback loop to ensure that any operational issues, outages, or lessons learned from disaster recovery tests result in process improvements.

questions.title: My sixth question
questions.description: What mechanisms are in place to ensure reliability and availability of disaster recovery systems during ongoing operations

choices.title: Using Auto Scaling to handle failovers and demand spikes during spikes during disasters

helpfulResource.displayText: Use Auto Scaling to handle resource demands during disaster recovery events.

improvementPlan.displayText: Implement Auto Scaling to ensure that disaster recovery resources automatically adjust to handle increased loads or failovers during a disaster event.

choices.title: Leveraging AWS Backup to ensure backup data is readily available

helpfulResource.displayText: Use AWS Backup to ensure reliable, readily available backups.

improvementPlan.displayText: Set up and regularly review AWS Backup policies to ensure critical disaster recovery data is being backed up according to business requirements.
